name: Development Cycle Meta-Router V1

stages.name: Request Classification
stages.description: Classify user request as bug fix, feature request, refactor, or question

decisions.description: Request is a simple code modification

stages.name: Bug Fix Pipeline
stages.description: Execute bug-fix-v1 pipeline for bug fixes

stages.name: Quick Code Change
stages.description: Handle simple, direct code modifications (1-5 lines)

stages.name: Feature Development Pipeline
stages.description: Execute feature-development-v1 pipeline for new features

stages.name: Handle Question
stages.description: Answer user questions about code or system

connections.description: Bug detected, route to bug-fix pipeline
Simple change requested, use direct code implementer
Feature requested, route to feature-development pipeline
Bug fix pipeline complete - PIPELINE ENDS
Feature development pipeline complete - PIPELINE ENDS

userContext: The user reports that ships are instantly jumping to throttle speed instead of accelerating and decelerating gradually. This is a physics/movement issue that needs investigation and fixing. Review the ship movement and throttle control code, identify where velocity changes are being applied instantly, and implement proper acceleration/deceleration mechanics so ships smoothly ramp up to target speed and smoothly slow down when throttle is reduced. The change should feel natural and give the player better control over ship momentum.

results.classify_request:
```json
{
  "classification": "BUG_FIX",
  "confidence": 0.98,
  "reasoning": "User explicitly reports that ships are 'instantly jumping to throttle speed instead of accelerating and decelerating gradually'. This describes broken behavior - the physics system is not working as intended. The expected behavior is smooth acceleration/deceleration, but the current behavior is instant velocity changes. This is a clear physics bug that needs investigation and fixing.",
  "context": {
    "originalRequest": "The user reports that ships are instantly jumping to throttle speed instead of accelerating and decelerating gradually. This is a physics/movement issue that needs investigation and fixing. Review the ship movement and throttle control code, identify where velocity changes are being applied instantly, and implement proper acceleration/deceleration mechanics so ships smoothly ramp up to target speed and smoothly slow down when throttle is reduced. The change should feel natural and give the player better control over ship momentum.",
    "keyIndicators": [
      "instantly jumping",
      "instead of accelerating gradually",
      "physics/movement issue",
      "needs investigation and fixing",
      "velocity changes being applied instantly"
    ],
    "affectedArea": "ship movement, physics system, throttle control, velocity/acceleration mechanics",
    "priority": "high",
    "technicalDetails": {
      "subsystem": "ShipPhysics.js, EVEPhysics.js, throttle control",
      "expectedBehavior": "Smooth acceleration/deceleration with gradual velocity changes",
      "actualBehavior": "Instant velocity jumps to target throttle speed",
      "rootCause": "Velocity being set directly instead of using acceleration over time"
    }
  }
}
```

DECISION: BUG_FIX
